content:
• Tuesday, February 17, 2015
  • LBTYA

    Filings show major buys, sales of Liberty Global

    • Along with the release of form 13Fs comes news of purchases and sales of stakes in European mega-cableco Liberty Global (LBTYA).
    • Coatue bought 1.4M shares to raise its stake in Liberty 34%, to 5.6M shares.
    • Tiger Consumer sold 25% of its stake, leaving it with 1.5M shares.
    • Today: LBTYA +0.7%, LBTYK +1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:34 PM
  • TKC

    Goldman lifts outlook on Turkcell

    • Goldman Sachs upgraded Turkish telecom Turkcell Iletisim Hizmetleri (NYSE:TKC) to Buy, from its previous rating of Neutral.
    • Its move (along with Citi's price target hike) is a rare bit of analyst sunshine after shares faced downgrades the past few months.
    • The stock continues to be responsive to ruble moves; today shares were down 1.7% despite Goldman's upgrade, as today the ruble slipped to 63.41/dollar.
    • The company cited currency losses from its operations in Ukraine and Belarus in explaining net income that dropped by half.
    • Other ruble-related telecoms: (VIP -2.6%), (MBT -2.7%)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:49 PM
  • VECO

    Veeco -2.7% due to soft Q1 guidance

    • Though it beat Q4 estimates, Veeco (NASDAQ:VECO) is guiding for Q1 revenue of $92M-$100M and EPS of -$0.07 to -$0.13, below a consensus of $121M and $0.14. The company blames deferred revenue recognition for sales of its new EPIK700 MOCVD systems to LED manufacturers.
    • On the bright side, Q4 bookings totaled $196M, well above revenue of $113.6M and Veeco's highest quarterly figure since 2011. MOCVD bookings (largely EPIK700-related) totaled $142M, and data storage equipment bookings $45M.
    • Near-term revenue forecasts have been lowered for Veeco's FAST-ALD flexible OLED tech due to existing deposition technology having "progressed to satisfy the current market requirements." Veeco plans to lower its FAST-ALD investments and take an asset impairment charge related to the business.
    • Gross margin rose to 38.5% from 22% a year ago. GAAP operating expenses rose 22% to $214.1M.
    • Shares have fallen to $30.30 AH.
    • Q4 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM
  • CVE

    Cenovus Energy to sell 67.5M shares at $22.25 each

    • Cenovus Energy (NYSE:CVE) -4.9% AH Cenovus Energy on news it entered into a bought-deal financing agreement to sell 67.5M common shares at $22.25/share.
    • CVE says the net proceeds of the offering, combined with its $3B of undrawn committed credit lines, will result in a stronger balance sheet and financial flexibility to help fund its planned $1.8B-$2B 2015 capex program.
    • CVE says it will continue expansion projects already under way at its core Foster Creek and Christina Lake projects in Alberta’s oil sands, and expects to produce up to 212K bbl/day of oil in 2015, up from 203K last year and 179K in 2013.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:25 PM | 5 Comments
  • BSX

    Boston Scientific settles J&J lawsuit, shares +12% AH

    • Boston Scientific (NYSE:BSX) +11.8% AH after settling the $7.2B lawsuit brought by Johnson & Johnson (NYSE:JNJ) for $600M, ending litigation that has nagged BSX since its 2006 acquisition of Guidant.
    • JNJ had sought damages after accusing Guidant of breaching their merger agreement by going with the higher offer from BSX.
    • BSX says it admits no liability in the settlement, and will record a $600M charge in its Q4 2014 financial results.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM | 4 Comments
  • ZIXI

    Zix -10.3% due to light sales guidance

    • Zix (NASDAQ:ZIXI) is guiding for Q1 revenue of $12.9M-$13.1M and EPS of $0.03-$0.04 vs. a consensus of $13.2M and $0.04, and full-year revenue of $54M-$56M and EPS of $0.19-$0.21 vs. a consensus of $56.1M and $0.20.
    • The e-mail encryption service provider had Q4 orders of $13.8M, -2% Y/Y but above revenue of $12.9M. Backlog rose by $500K Q/Q and $3.6M Y/Y to $69.3M.
    • Gross margin fell to 82.9% from 84.6% a year ago. GAAP operating expenses rose 29% to $9M (well above revenue growth of 4.5%), leading op. margin to fall to 13% from 28%.
    • Shares are down to $3.40 AH.
    • Q4 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ENPH +14.1%. BSX +11.6%. PBPB +9.9%. LINC +8.7%. YGE +6.9%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: PERY -14.3%. FOSL -13.4%. ZIXI -10.0%. LZB -7.3%. RAX -4.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • PERY

    Perry Ellis cuts guidance due to West Coast port disruption, shares -15% AH

    • Perry Ellis (NASDAQ:PERY) -14.8% AH after cutting guidance for its business year ended in January and providing a downside outlook for the current year because of impacts from west coast port disruptions.
    • PERY says it had a solid order base in Q4 but was unable to fill $23M in sales orders due to late receipt of goods resulting from port delays that have caused more than a two-week lag in delivering shipments to customers.
    • For its FQ4 (Jan.), PERY sees EPS of $0.01-$0.04 vs. $0.43 analyst consensus estimate and revenues of $218M vs. $242M consensus; for FY 2015, PERY cuts its EPS estimate to $0.50-$0.53 and revenue to $890M from earlier guidance of $0.85-$0.95 EPS on revenues of $910M-$920M.
    • Says its retail stores and e-commerce business performed well in FQ4, posting respective 1% and 36% sales comp increases.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • GSAT

    Globalstar sails as Kerrisdale exits short options

    • Globalstar (NYSEMKT:GSAT) gained 6.3% today (and is on the move after hours, +2%).
    • Hedge fund Kerrisdale Advisers filed a 13F indicating it closed out its bearish position of $7.3M in put options, as of Dec. 31.
    • Kerrisdale's Sahm Adrangi famously knocked Globalstar shares for a loop in early October by pricing the firm's equity at $0: "Globalstar's equity is worthless. It is not worth $4 billion, or $3 billion, or $1 billion. It is worth nothing."
    • Shares had risen 58% in the 52 weeks prior to Adrangi's take; they slipped some 25% in the wake of rumors that he had gone short.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM | 15 Comments
  • PBPB

    Potbelly +8.7% after earnings beat

    • Potbelly (NASDAQ:PBPB) reports comparable-store sales rose 3.7% at company-owned shops in FQ4 to lift it to a 0.1% gain for the 52-week period.
    • Shop-level profit margin -70 bps to 18.3% during the quarter.
    • Costs of good rate +10 bps to 29.0%.
    • Store count +19 Q/Q consisting of 16 company-operated shops nd 3 franchised shops.
    • PBPB +8.7% in after-hours trading with the company's guidance for 48-55 new shops in 2015 helping to provide a lift.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • ENPH

    Enphase +12.1% on Q4 beat, strong Q1 guidance

    • In addition to beating Q4 estimates, Enphase (NASDAQ:ENPH) is guiding for Q1 revenue of $84M-$88M, above an $81.8M consensus and good for 49% Y/Y growth at the midpoint. Operating expenses are expected to rise 2%-5% Q/Q.
    • 180MW of microinverter systems (799K units) were shipped in Q4, +6% Q/Q and +67% Y/Y. Gross margin rose to 33.5% from 33% in Q3, and 32.3% a year ago. With revenues dropping due to seasonality, GM is expected to fall to 31%-33% in Q1.
    • Operating expenses rose 43% Y/Y to $30.4M. Enphase ended 2014 with $42M in cash and no debt.
    • Shares have risen to $15.60 AH. They fell 8.2% in regular trading.
    • Q4 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • JACK

    Double-digit comp for Qdoba in FQ1

    • Jack in the Box (NASDAQ:JACK) reports system-wide comparable-store sales rose 4.4% at the Jack in the Box chain and 14.0% at Qdoba during FQ1.
    • Catering sales and a new simpler menu helped to boost sales at Qdoba.
    • Consolidated restaurant operating margin +100 bps to 19.3% on a sales leverage lift.
    • SG&A expense rate +40 bps to 13.5%.
    • Guidance: The company sees same-store sales growth of 5%-7% in FQ2 for Jack in the Box and 7.0%-9.0% at Qdoba. Full-year EPS of $2.85-$2.87 expected.
    • JACK +2.65% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • LEE

    Lee Enterprises soars 7.7% as Wingspan discloses 9.1% stake

    • Lee Enterprises (NYSE:LEE) finished up 7.7% as Wingspan Investment Management disclosed a 9.1% passive stake, making it one of Lee's biggest shareholders.
    • Wingspan has a longstanding relationship with Lee as former members of its investment team shaped Lee's 2012 restructuring, and the firm was an anchor investor in refinancing last year.
    • The firm disclosed its beneficial ownership of the stake of 4.98M shares in its 13G.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • RAX

    Rackspace -5.8% on soft Q1/2015 guidance

    • With forex providing a 1% headwind, Rackspace (NYSE:RAX) expects Q1 revenue of $477M-$488M, below a $490.5M consensus. Full-year revenue guidance is at $2B-$2.1B vs. a $2.08B consensus (2% forex headwind).
    • Q4 adjusted EBITDA margin was 35%, +50 bps Q/Q and +260 bps Y/Y, and at the high end of a 33%-35% guidance range. However, Q1 guidance is at 32%-34% (cloud price pressure?), and full-year guidance at 33%-36% (still favorable to 2014's 33.7% at the midpoint).
    • Dedicated cloud (Web hosting) revenue rose 8% Y/Y in Q4 to $324.7M, a slowdown from Q3's 14%. Public cloud revenue (inc. OpenStack) grew 26% to $147.7M after growing 29% in Q3. Servers deployed rose to 112.7K from 110.5K in Q3 and 103.9K a year ago, and average revenue/server grew to $1,412 from $1,405 and $1,322.
    • Gross margin was 67.4%, up 20 bps Y/Y but down 150 bps Q/Q. Total costs/expenses rose 11% Y/Y to $422.4M (less than revenue growth of 15.8%).
    • Free cash flow was $55M, above net income of $36.9M. $105M (22% of revenue) was spent on capex.
    • Shares have fallen to $47.00 in AH trading. They went into earnings up more than $12 from where they traded prior to Rackspace's Q3 report.
    • Q4 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • FOSL

    Fossil -13.6% as promotions whack bottom line

    • Fossil (FOSL +0.9%) reports global comparable store sales increased 7.7% in Q4.
    • Sales by category: Watches -1%, leathers -2%, jewelry +13%.
    • Gross margin rate -60 bps to 56.8% with promotional activity increased.
    • Operating margin rate -110 bps to 16.1%.
    • Guidance: FY15 sales expected to fall 7.5% to 5.5%. Operating margin seen in 6%-7% range.
    • FOSL -13.6% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • AMC

    AMC Entertainment beats by $0.10, revenue in-line

    • AMC Entertainment (NYSE:AMC): Q4 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.10.
    • Revenue of $712.16M (-0.1% Y/Y) in-line.
    • Shares +2.75%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • AMBA

    Ambarella follows GoPro higher

    • Ambarella (AMBA +3.7%) is closing with healthy gains as heavily-shorted top customer GoPro posts a 12%+ gain amid a lockup expiration and bullish coverage from Northland Securities.
    • The video processor maker's FQ4 report arrives on March 3. Shares remain down 11% from where they traded before GoPro's Feb. 5 Q4 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • NRP

    Natural Resource downgraded to Hold from Buy at BB&T

    • Natural Resource Partners (NRP -2.5%) sinks to 52-week lows after shares are downgraded to Hold from Buy at BB&T, which says the upside case is not compelling even after the stock's 17% YTD decline.
    • The firm says NRP likely will have to bite the bullet and cut distributions again, in light of coal prices unlikely to recover in 2015-16, oil prices down ~30% since Thanksgiving, and the company facing $81M of debt due in 2015 with another $75M due in Jan. 2016 and a credit facility that comes due in August of next year.
    • BB&T thinks NRP's fair value is ~$8 based on the its new annual distribution assumption of $0.80/unit.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 3 Comments
  • OCN

    Strong bounce for nonbank servicers continues

    • The gains over the past few sessions are little more than a blip on the nasty longer-term charts, but they represent sizable moves. Ocwen (OCN +3.3%) is higher by about 50% from its late-January low, as is Walter Investment (WAC +13.3%).
    • Slightly more subdued is Home Loan Servicing (HLSS +2.2%) - up about 33% from late January.
    • Other names of interest: Nationstar Mortgage (NSM), Altisource Portfolio (ASPS +4.7%), Altisource Asset Management (AAMC +4.3%).
    • Previously: Barron's: Walter Investment shares set for potential double (Feb. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 2 Comments
  • P

    Pandora gives up some gains as Macquarie initiates coverage

    • Pandora Media (NYSE:P) made up some ground last week (+4.2%) from a 17% drop following its earnings, but is trading off again today, -2.9%.
    • B. Riley has reiterated its Neutral rating on the stock and set a $12.50 price target.
    • Macquarie today initiated coverage of Pandora with a Neutral rating and a $16 target.
    • Pandora's in the midst of ongoing court battles, including a consumer privacy case in Michigan (where plaintiffs are urging a pro-Pandora decision be overturned) and a licensing-fee dispute in New York with publishing firm BMI.
    • Shares are trading at $15.
    • Previously: Pandora's Q4: Gains in listeners, listener hours, RPMs (Feb. 05 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 18 Comments
  • PTR

    WSJ: China considers merging state-owned oil companies

    • China may merge its state-owned oil companies to create giants that will be more efficient and capable of taking on big overseas rivals, WSJ reports.
    • One plan reportedly would combine the country’s largest oil companies, CNPC (PTR +2%) and Sinopec (SNP +4.2%), while other options include merging Cnooc (CEO +1.8%) with Sinochem.
    • The firms have expanded into each others’ turf over the years, creating overlapping operations that span everything from exploration to refining to running gas pumps.
    • No timetable is set for a decision on whether or when to proceed with the mergers, WSJ says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM

  • Gold's 2015 gains vanish

    • Down 1.6% today to $1,208 per ounce, gold - after popping over $1,300 in mid-January - has roughly returned to its level from the year's start.
    • Don't blame the dollar. It's is still strong, but gold's decline over the past month has come as the greenback has given back some of its big gains. instead the yellow metal's bear move is the near mirror image of the sharp rise in long-term bond yields.
    • GLD -1.7%
    • ETFs: GLD, IAU, SGOL, UGL, DGP, GLL, UGLD, DZZ, GLDI, OUNZ, DGL, DGZ, DGLD, AGOL, TBAR, UBG, BAR, GYEN, GEUR, BARS
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 26 Comments
  • HLX

    Helix Energy sinks after posting weak Q4, warning of difficult 2015

    • Helix Energy Solutions (HLX -12.4%) plunges to 52-week lows after reporting Q4 earnings that fell 78% Y/Y and came in well short of analyst expectations, and revenues fell 8.6% Y/Y and also missed estimates.
    • HLX cited two unexpected events: a supply boat that collided with its Q4000 vessel and impaired its riser system for an extended time, and another vessel that was out of work for 59 days because of a late job cancellation.
    • Q4 revenues in the Well Intervention segment fell 41% Y/Y as vessel utilization fell to 64% from 95% in Q3, and Robotics segment revenues slid 39% as vessel utilization dropped to 79% from 90% in Q3.
    • CEO Owen Kratz said during today's earnings conference call that 2015 likely will be a difficult year and producers are canceling offshore contracts despite termination fees; however, HLX probably will not make deep cuts to its workforce of 1,600 after shrinking GS&A costs when it reorganized itself and sold off non-core assets in recent years.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM

  • Reversal nearly complete as Treasury yields surge higher

    • As remarkable as the tumble in long-term Treasury yields in January has been the nearly complete reversal of the move in just half as much time in February.
    • Today's nine basis point rise in the 10-year to 2.14% puts that yield just four basis points below where it started 2015. The move comes as the Fed over the past two weeks no longer leaves any doubt of its intention to hike the Fed Funds rate sooner rather than later, with June more and more looking like the time for lift-off.
    • Fed Funds futures haven't priced in a full 25 basis point move until late-summer.
    • TLT -1.6%, TBT +3.2% on the session
    • Previously: June rate hike chorus grows louder (Feb. 16)
    • ETFs: TBT, TLT, TMV, SHY, IEF, TBF, EDV, TMF, PST, TTT, ZROZ, SBND, TLH, IEI, TYO, VGLT, DLBS, DTYS, BIL, UST, UBT, TLO, VGSH, VGIT, SHV, TBX, SCHO, GSY, TENZ, SCHR, DTYL, TYD, LBND, ITE, DTUS, SST, TYBS, DLBL, DTUL, TUZ, DFVL, FIVZ, TBZ, DFVS, TYNS, SYTL
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM | 7 Comments
  • GLF

    Gulfmark Offshore drops to decade lows

    • Gulfmark Offshore (GLF -9.6%) plunges to its lowest in more than a decade despite presenting better than expected Q4 earnings and revenue that matched expectations.
    • Upstaging Q4 results was the disclosure of changes in the terms for two of its loan agreements limiting the amount it can pay for dividends, share repurchases or acquisitions.
    • The revisions reducing some of GLF's interest coverage ratio requirements in exchange for the new financial restrictions affect both the company's $300M multi-currency facility as well as its NOK600M multi-currency revolving credit facility.
    • In its earnings conference call, GLF management says it will be looking to shore up its operations through some sales of older vessels and plans to suspend its share buyback program to ensure the ability to pay dividends.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • VIPS

    VIPS soars on earnings, guidance; JD, DANG, LITB also rally

    • Vipshop (VIPS +14.4%) has surged to new 52-week highs after trouncing Q4 revenue estimates (and posting a more moderate EPS beat) and guiding for Q1 revenue of $1.25B-$1.3B (above a consensus of $1.22B and good for 78%-85% Y/Y growth). Given the company's history, the guidance might be conservative.
    • Vipshop's active customers rose 114.2% Y/Y in Q4 to 12.2M, and its orders rose 99.6% to 35.3M. Mobile made up a whopping 66% of GMV, up from Q3's 57% and above Alibaba's 42%.
    • Gross margin rose 40 bps Y/Y to 24.9%, and operating expenses grew 115% to $287.5M (exceeded revenue growth of 108.9%). Fulfillment spend  +73.9%; marketing +135.5%; tech/content +168.9%; G&A +209.2%.
    • Chinese e-commerce peers JD.com (JD +2.4%), Dangdang (DANG +5.8%), and LightInTheBox (LITB +3.4%) are following Vipshop higher. Vipshop and JD.com have both argued their internal logistics/fulfillment investments give them an edge over many of the sellers relying on Alibaba's platforms.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • MHRCQ

    Magnum Hunter, Rice Energy eye strong production amid reduced capex

    • Magnum Hunter Resources (MHR +3.8%) is higher after announcing a $100M capex budget for 2015, down from its $400M plan for last year, that it expects will enable it to maintain its projected 2015 average daily production volumes of 29K-33K boe/day.
    • Rice Energy (RICE +1.8%) also is higher after revealing a 2015 capital budget of $890M, down from $1.1B, while projecting a 64%-72% Y/Y net production increase to 450M-470M cfe/day, an expected increase of 64%-72% over 2014 net production.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 2 Comments
  • FEYE

    FEYE, CYBR, IMPV, KEYW rally after banking hack, Cramer remarks

    • Kaspersky Labs uncovered an international hacking ring that (using sophisticated malware) has stolen up to $1B from 100+ banks in 30 countries. The scheme goes back to 2013, with the attackers coming from China and Europe.
    • Also: Jim Cramer argued on CNBC cybersecurity firms still have room to run, and cited FireEye (FEYE +4.8%) and CyberArk's (CYBR +10.1%) Q4 numbers (I, II) as evidence of the industry's momentum.
    • FireEye and CyberArk are adding strongly to last week's big earnings-driven gains. Imperva (IMPV +3%) and KEYW Holding (KEYW +3%) are also rallying.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • EBIX

    Ebix +12.7% on reported U.K. deal win

    • The Insurance Insider reports Ebix (EBIX) has won a contract from a board created by London market insurers and brokers to create an IT platform that will enable electronic insurance payments.
    • Shares have soared to their highest levels since 2011.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 11 Comments
  • TOWN

    TowneBank on the move after Barron's writeup

    • Towne (TOWN +6%) just-completed $275M purchase of Richmond's Franklin Financial will be slightly dilutive to earnings and book value this year, but should begin paying dividends in 2016, writes David Englander.
    • At 1.3x tangible book vs 1.7x for peers, and 12x earnings vs. an 18 multiple for peers, the stock looks cheap. Other than rising earnings, a possible catalyst could be analyst coverage - there currently isn't any thanks to the bank's small size, but January's acquisition could change that.
    • Another favorite of Englander's column, State Bank Financial (STBZ +2.2%) is higher since being written up in November, but the stock's still a buy at 1.4x tangible book. The stock yields 1% after boosting the dividend 25% last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • DDD

    3D printing stocks hammered

    • After rebounding over the last couple of weeks in spite of Stratasys' Feb. 2 warning, 3D printer makers are seeing more pain today.
    • 3D Systems (DDD -5.9%), Stratasys (SSYS -4.7%), ExOne (XONE -3.8%), and Voxeljet (VJET -5.8%) are all posting big declines. Voxeljet and (to a lesser extent) 3D Systems have seen above-average volume, while Stratasys and ExOne have seen below-average volume.
    • 3D Systems' Q4 report is due on Feb. 26. If history is any guide, ExOne will also report this month. Voxeljet doesn't report until March 26.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM | 17 Comments
  • SCON

    SCON -19.8% after selling shares at $2

    • Superconductor Technologies (NASDAQ:SCON) has sold 917K shares via warrant exercise agreements at $2 apiece, below a Friday close of $2.73 and down from a 2013 warrant exercise price of $2.57.
    • Gross proceeds are expected to total $1.83M. Financial advisor H.C. Wainwright will receive 7% of the gross proceeds and a 5-year warrant to buy 5% of the number of shares exercised at a price equal to 110% of Friday's close.
    • Shares have made fresh 52-week lows following the disclosure.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • BSTG

    HART up again capital raise

    • Thinly-traded nano cap Harvard Apparatus Regenerative Technology (HART +26.7%) heads north again on a 7x surge in volume albeit on turnover of less than 520K. Shares have jumped almost 80% since the company announced its equity offering that will raise ~$9M.
    • Previously: HART prices public offering (Feb. 12)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • MGM

    MGM Resorts talks REIT on earnings call

    • Executives with MGM Resorts (NYSE:MGM) say the company will explore converting real estate assets into a REIT as part of a process where it looks at "all avenues" for growth.
    • Shares of MGM Resorts are up 2.84% after opening the day in negative territory.
    • Earnings call webcast
    • Previously: MGM Resorts EPS of -$0.70
    • Previously: MGM Resorts -1.7% after China drags down Q4 results
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM | 13 Comments
  • CRNT

    Ceragon +12.3% after announcing Vodafone Portugal deal

    • Vodafone Portugal is using Ceragon's (NASDAQ:CRNT) FibeAir IP-20C RF backhaul systems to "support  a unique project" to handle 3G/4G traffic at major public events.
    • Shares are at their highest levels since December. Ceragon moved higher last week after announcing a deal with a U.S. government telecom contractor, and the week before that on a deal with a major (unnamed) mobile carrier.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • FCH

    FelCor sells two properties, agrees to third

    • Sold by FelCor Loding (FCH +3.4%) are the 225-room Embassy Suites Hotel Raleigh and the 536-room Westin Dallas Park Central for total gross proceeds of $63.6M. The money will be used to pay down debt.
    • FelCor also agrees to the sale of the 261-room Embassy Suites Hotel San Antonio for $29.5M.
    • The moves bring the company closer to the end of its portfolio repositioning plan, with sales now totaling 34 non-strategic hotels for aggregate gross proceeds of $764M. There are six remaining to be sold.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: ROSG-OLD +38%. OTC:ESMC +21%. HART +20%. EGRX +18%. VISN +18%. ROIA +17%. KNDI +16%. LTRX +14%. SRPT +14%. NVFY +14%.
    • Losers: CLTX -80%. SGNL -26%. SCON -21%. CADC -17%. HOLI -15%. CLRX -15%. HLX -15%. RVP -13%. GLF -12%. AETI -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • ENPH

    Enphase down 7.7% ahead of earnings

    • Enphase (NASDAQ:ENPH) is off sharply ahead of this afternoon's Q4 report. 475K shares have been traded vs. a 3-month daily average of 689K.
    • The solar microinverter maker had been on a tear in recent weeks: Going into today, shares were up 48% from a Jan. 15 close of $10.27.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 5 Comments
  • N

    NetSuite falls below $100 on bearish BNP coverage

    • BNP Paribas has launched coverage on NetSuite (N -3%) with an Underperform rating and $87 target.
    • Shares are back below $100 after rallying above the level last week. NetSuite sold off hard three weeks ago after providing soft Q1/2015 guidance during its Q4 CC.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • CCG

    Capmus Crest soars following activist bid, company response

    • "While we do not know which direction the board will ultimately go, we believe shareholders will win in either event," says Wunderlich's Craig Kucera, upgrading Campus Crest Communities (CCG +10.4%) to Buy, with price target boosted to approximate NAV of $8.25.
    • Previously: Under activist pressure, Campus Crest exploring strategic alternatives (Feb. 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • FSL

    Freescale drops on valuation-driven RBC downgrade

    • With shares having more than doubled from their October lows, RBC has downgraded Freescale (FSL -2%) to Sector Perform, while keeping its $33 target intact.

  • MU

    Micron gains after analyst day, upgrade

    • Macquarie has upgraded Micron (MU +2.2%) to Outperform following the memory giant's Friday analyst day. RBC and Jefferies have respectively hiked their targets to $44 and $45.
    • Macquarie believes annual EPS of $6 and free cash flow of $5B is possible, and estimates Micron's 2016 free cash flow yield is 13%. Jefferies is upbeat about Micron's tech progress and the margin boost provided by the new Inotera deal.
    • Wedbush ($40 target) notes Micron forecasts only 25% DRAM bit supply growth going forward (down from the 33% CAGR seen from 2010-2014), and that (in spite of recent NAND price pressure) it expects NAND supply to be "constrained over the near to long term given diverse end-market demand drivers and complicated 3D transitions." 38% NAND bit supply growth is expected.
    • SA author Electric Phred notes Micron suggested its 3D NAND offerings will give it a cost advantage, and thinks Micron and Samsung could have a 3D NAND duopoly.

    Moffett downgrades cablecos on cord cutting, regulatory risks

    • Telecom analyst Craig Moffett sees not enough bad news priced in (and too much good), and has downgraded key cable stocks (CMCSA, CHTR, TWC) to Neutral from Buy.
    • He's still got a Sell rating on Cablevision (CVC -5%).
    • “With the stocks having largely achieved our target prices, with cord cutting risks mounting and with regulation clouding the path forward in broadband, it seems to us to be time to reduce exposure," Moffett says.
    • He lowers his estimate of a successful Comcast-TWC merger to 60% given increasing public attention and sentiment against the combination.
    • And he doesn't mince words about Title II treatment: "At its core, Title II is about price regulation ... It would be naive to believe" that the rules changes won't introduce risk to pricing power.

    • RGS Energy (NASDAQ:RGSE) has plunged below $0.30 after announcing it expects to report Q4 revenue of $18M from continuing ops, even with the year-ago period; the sole analyst estimate is at $23.9M.
    • A $13M+ loss is expected from continuing ops, and a $16M net loss if RGS' discontinued commercial ops are included. Both figures include an $11M impairment charge for RGS' 2014 acquisition of Hawaiian solar installer Sunetric.
    • RGS adds it will no longer have positive net worth thanks to the impairment charge, and thus won't meet Nasdaq listing requirements. The company is "evaluating this matter."
    • RGS ended 2014 with $1.95M in cash, and $4.35M in line-of-credit borrowings. The company "needs to, an intends to, raise additional financing" to help convert its ~$55M backlog and better position itself to renew is credit line under favorable terms.
    • The pre-announcement is easily overshadowing news of a partnership with East Coast rooftop solar system provider Centrosolar America. RGS expects the deal to increase its East Coast installation capacity by 1MW-2MW/month starting in Q2.

    • Though launching coverage at Neutral due to the company's multiples, JPMorgan praises "Box's differentiated focus on rich and complex features for corporate IT departments, spanning security, compliance, workflow and auditing."
    • Morgan Stanley (Equal-Weight) predicts "a growing enterprise ecosystem will offset competitive pressures over time," but also considers a current enterprise value of 7x 2016E sales fair in light of "near-term limits on growth and margins."

  • VBLT

    Vascular Biogenics off big premarket on failed clinical trial

    • Thinly-traded micro cap Vascular Biogenics (NASDAQ:VBLT) craters 46% premarket on robust volume in response to the company's announcement that a Phase 2 trial evaluating its lead Lecinoxoid compound VB-201 for the treatment of psoriasis and ulcerative colitis (UC) failed to achieve its primary efficacy endpoints.
    • In the psoriasis trial, the primary endpoint was PASI 50 (proportion of patients who experienced at least a 50% improvement from baseline) Weeks 16 and 24. No effect versus placebo was observed. PASI 50 at Week 16 was 26.4% versus placebo's 38.0%.
    • In the UC trial, the primary endpoint was disease remission at Weeks 12 and 24, which was 10.5% at Week 12 compared to placebo's 15.1%.
    • Unsurprisingly, the company will cease development of VB-201 for these indications.
    • This is not the first misstep by the company. In August, it cancelled its IPO after six days of trading after a key investor failed to follow through on a commitment to buy shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
